channel.title: Tech on Sylvan's Abracadabra
channel.description: Recent content in Tech on Sylvan's Abracadabra

item.title: C++ Coroutine Notes
item.description: C++ Coroutine Notes Stackful vs Stackless The Coroutine Handles/Objects Coroutine Handle Awaiter promise_type The Coroutine Operators co_await co_yield co_return Reference The funtinality of coroutine in C++ is more of a semi-finished product. It doesn’t provide the users a handy way to invoke a coroutine. For instance, in Golang, we can set off a goroutine readily by letting go of any functions. On the contrary, C++’s post-20 standards come with some ‘gadgets’ which are the building blocks for the programmers to build a fully functioning architecture of coroutine.

item.title: Inverted Index Notes
item.description: Inverted Index Notes The Definition The File Organization Optimizations Cache Compression Smart Traversing Reference I’ve been working on inverted index these days. Hence, it’s a good time to do some summaries on it. I am going to split the notes into three parts: what is an inverted index, the possible file organization of it, and some of the optimizations to enhance its working efficiency. The Definition As the name shows, it’s inverted, but what is the inversion meant to be?
